alert.note: Alert for Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Sussex, northwestern Warren, Monroe and northern Northampton Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 649 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Tobyhanna to Paradise Valley to Rossland. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Blairstown, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Hope, East Bangor, Stormville, Henryville, Brodheadsville, Kunkletown, Werry Lake, Millbrook, Delaware Water Gap, Skytop, Tannersville, Mountainhome and Alpine Mountain. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 300 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 15. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 8 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
